column1: Stair is #TeamWarner because she supports Mark Warner's diligent work in protecting our elections and leadership in the country's coronavirus response. https://t.co/6nT5vQluzX

Mark Warner is committed to expanding health care options and lowering prescription drug prices for Virginians while working to make sure that everyone has the resources they need to make it through the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/3Jue6soLqN
Karen is on #TeamWarner because of Mark Warner's work to protect Virginians and our economy during and after the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/yTJwyzExrd
Jennifer is on #TeamWarner because as a business owner she has seen the work Mark Warner put in to protect small businesses especially during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/7IMngIw8Ov

The coronavirus pandemic has proven that there is no infrastructure more important than fast reliable broadband. And as our economy becomes more digital Mark will continue to push for broadband access to unlock economic potential and level the playing field for everyone. https://t.co/xDQCAQESfS

.@QasimRashid is right: broadband access is a necessity not a nice to have - especially during the coronavirus pandemic. We've made progress but there's still work to be done to make sure every Virginian has access to reliable affordable broadband. https://t.co/aeAOlniZP4

Expanded telehealth services are essential especially during the coronavirus pandemic. Mark Warner fought for legislation to provide these services including to those battling substance abuse.  #VASenateDebate

It's disrespectful of the President to assume that Gold Star family members gave him COVID. The American people have seen his failure to follow public health guidelines to protect himself and those around him since the start of the pandemic. https://t.co/y0P4XD75GX

Mark Warner is holding a town hall with students from around the Commonwealth on 10/8 at 4:30 PM ET to discuss the challenges they face during coronavirus and beyond. Sign up and tune in ⬇️https://t.co/6tW8C13FhF

The Trump administration is not handling the pandemic appropriately -- and the public knows it. The President's failure to acknowledge the grave threat of coronavirus put millions of lives at risk. https://t.co/KED3HWwXnk

While the President and Mark's GOP opponent downplayed the risk of COVID-19 at the beginning of the pandemic Mark worked to expand free testing and give relief to small businesses through the CARES Act. #VASenateDebate
With Mark’s continued leadership he will continue to ensure that we can flatten the curve of the spread of the coronavirus to get our economy back on track. #TeamWarner #VASenateDebate

Black Americans are disproportionately contracting and dying of Covid-19. As the administration fails to record the data on this Mark introduced the Equitable Data Collection and Disclosure on COVID-19 Act to create accountability. #VASenateDebate

Mark Warner will get the coronavirus vaccine when Dr. Fauci okays it. He’s focused on making sure that all communities weather the pandemic with legislation like the Jobs and Neighborhood Investment Act. #VApol #VASen

Had a great time at a socially distant event to support my friend Qasim Rashid running to represent folks in #VA01. Looking forward to seeing the great things he'll do to represent the Commonwealth. -MW https://t.co/SUqyTduQuG

With school systems pivoting online due to the coronavirus pandemic and becoming vulnerable to online attacks Mark Warner is urging Congress to invest in securing our public schools from cybersecurity attacks. https://t.co/e5ccySNjyi

The coronavirus has shown us that our economy will be leaning towards more digital jobs in the future. This means we must continue to push for broadband access for all Virginians and everyone across the country. https://t.co/CAdA5ydnVU

Our economy is only going to come back if we can stop the spread of coronavirus. Decisions to re-open should be made using science and data - not according to President Trump's political agenda.  -MW https://t.co/F722lnxDKg
Mark Warner and @timkaine are holding a virtual Town Hall on Thursday 9/10 to talk about issues facing Virginia families during the coronavirus pandemic. Register here: https://t.co/UfzbijPlgt

We've got to protect those hit hardest by the coronavirus pandemic. That's why I led the charge to expand unemployment benefits protect families facing eviction and provide low-interest loans for small businesses. I won't give up the fight. -MW https://t.co/UghLYIruLW
Last week Mark Warner met with business leaders in Shenandoah County to talk about the support they need to make it through the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/qHgUJseqby

Our economy is going to look different post-coronavirus. This week Mark talked with community leaders in Winchester about how we can better equip our young people for this changing economy. https://t.co/vWAmh4EXc8

This week I was in southwest Virginia to see how folks are doing in this midst of the coronavirus pandemic. It's clear that Washington has a lot of work to do to provide relief for these families. We can't afford to wait any longer. -MW https://t.co/ivfrVfblNd

I checked in with medical professionals at @JiraniCoffee to discuss health care during the coronavirus pandemic. A record number of people are without it when they need it most and I know we've got to do something now before it's too late. -MW https://t.co/etnKZvV4J3

Met with small business leaders this morning at @Twinpanzee Brewing Co. for a socially distant community check-up to discuss the effects of the coronavirus pandemic on their industry and the steps we need to take for our economy to recover. -MW https://t.co/sRb7CReweY

Had a great time checking in with folks in Woodstock at the Woodstock Brew House yesterday. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy and they bear the brunt of the coronavirus pandemic. I will continue to work with my colleagues in DC to ensure their needs are heard. -MW https://t.co/4zjR0J0bod

I was glad to meet with @DrCameronWebb and healthcare professionals for a socially distant roundtable discussion yesterday in Charlottesville. We have a real chance to flip the 5th and I believe in Cameron’s ability to lead the change we need. -MW https://t.co/E7dYG8x2fB
As we continue to face the coronavirus pandemic there’s no better person to represent Virginia’s 5th Congressional District than @DrCameronWebb. -MW https://t.co/qGOuiYr4j3
In his latest virtual town hall Mark Warner spoke about what might be included in the next round of coronavirus relief legislation. https://t.co/RiaE5JVxG6

Coronavirus hasn't gone away - cases are still ticking upward in the Commonwealth and around the country. Please continue to follow the advice of health care experts. Wear a mask - it saves lives. - MW https://t.co/IXNSTPzCFc

No-excuse absentee voting is the safest way to vote during the coronavirus pandemic. Voting begins 45 days before the election. Request your ballot through the @vaELECT website. https://t.co/KO8JtrFJ7U https://t.co/GWKX2j7zVA
To ensure we're meeting the needs of our active duty military and their families we need more financial support for testing and tracing the coronavirus.  https://t.co/MA0PguOEZf

Restaurants have been especially hard-hit by the coronavirus pandemic. This week Mark Warner joined a bi-partisan group of Senate colleagues in sponsoring a bill to help independent restaurants and support reemployment of 11 million workers. https://t.co/84hEkTnNlp
As we see a surge in coronavirus cases in Virginia and in many communities across the country I urge everyone to listen to the science and to health professionals. Wear a mask. -MW
Low-income communities and communities of color have been hit hardest by COVID-19. Mark Warner talked with @1a about how to get assistance to those who need it most. https://t.co/eEoR0VHjqt
A $2.9 billion fund reserved for economic recovery from the coronavirus pandemic to promote community revitalization and development.

A $7 billion investment in Community Development Financial Institutions (CDFIs) and Minority Depository Institutions (MDIs) to build long-term ability for these institutions to lend in underserved communities and expand flexibility for borrowers during the coronavirus pandemic.

Mark Warner introduced the Jobs and Neighborhood Investment Act to help Black and brown communities that have been disproportionately impacted by the coronavirus pandemic withstand the outbreak and emerge even stronger. Here's what the bill covers ⬇️

Mark Warner is focused on making sure that workers don't lose their health care benefits during the coronavirus pandemic. The Employee Retention Credit he's proposing is just one way of achieving that. https://t.co/9duc3yILW8
Mark Warner and @TheRevAl discuss Mark's new bill to make sure that Black-owned businesses get their fair share of coronavirus stimulus funding. https://t.co/HVdSrpGeR8

Coronavirus ushered in an unprecedented need for telework distance learning and telehealth shedding light on the need to expand access to affordable and reliable broadband. Read Mark's proposal for a $100 billion investment in broadband infrastructure. https://t.co/6sv1BXYw0p

Mark Warner is working on a new bill to expand economic opportunity in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic making sure that everyone has access to the federal grants and loans they need. https://t.co/TpsEq78qmc

Coronavirus isn't taking a break for the holiday weekend. This weekend please continue to follow public health guidelines from @CDCgov. Wearing a mask is doing your part to protect the people you love and everyone you meet.

Senator Warner can get a little bit in the weeds when he's talking about the financial stimulus packages he helped pass in response to the coronavirus pandemic. We got him to give us a short lesson. https://t.co/3HGnMTYSka

Expanded telehealth availability during the coronavirus pandemic allowed those on Medicare to get the care they need while reducing their risk of further infection. Mark Warner and @timkaine are joining Senate colleagues to push for a permanent expansion. https://t.co/kxAYxyWpHt

As we conclude #AAPIHeritageMonth I'm grateful for the contributions of AAPI communities across Virginia. I recognize that the Covid-19 outbreak was challenging for this community and I'm making sure we take concrete steps to address a rise in discrimination and hate crimes.
Mark Warner is working hard to make sure that our coronavirus relief packages address the challenges faced by communities across the Commonwealth especially rural communities. https://t.co/yP1vVEIR1M
Coronavirus has taken a serious toll on families and communities across the country. This number represents a staggering amount of lives lost and grieving loved ones. https://t.co/ZvDN8OOpGf

The Hispanic Resources Center is working with organizations in Hampton Roads to set up free coronavirus testing clinics with Spanish-speaking medical staff. This is a critical step toward ensuring that everyone has access to the care and information they need during the pandemic. https://t.co/PIw8gXpMvi
Mark Warner's Paycheck Security Act would reconnect workers who were laid off during the coronavirus pandemic with their health care benefits - and guarantee them a paycheck. https://t.co/ns6Q5p6F1R
The front page of the New York Times is a sobering reminder of the toll coronavirus has taken on families and communities across the country. https://t.co/V2ihBbOTcj

It's critical that state and local governments have the funds they need to deal with the economic impact of coronavirus. Mark Warner is working hard to make sure these localities have the resources they need. https://t.co/czIhQIZM7M
Mark Warner knows the importance of protecting workers during the coronavirus pandemic and is prepared to fight tooth and nail to make sure that everyone is taken care of. https://t.co/MjaGpYgxIk

Mark Warner is committed to talking with leaders across the Commonwealth to better understand coronavirus's impact on their communities and make sure that our relief packages are working for everyone. https://t.co/PdtUGb0sYf
Mark Warner is calling for a national COVID-19 testing plan now and a plan to fairly distribute a vaccine once we have one. https://t.co/DMxAgwyYdJ

Mark Warner is holding another virtual town hall next Monday at 5:45 pm ET to answer your questions about coronavirus and everything he's working on in the Senate. Sign up below! https://t.co/Kl4L3YdZDt
Mark is working with colleagues on both sides of the aisle to protect our miners through the coronavirus outbreak by ensuring that their health and safety is prioritized. https://t.co/ALjZ1y4b4J

Thank you to all of our essential workers: health care professionals but also pharmacists grocery store workers sanitation workers farmers and all others who are on the front lines of our coronavirus response. -MW https://t.co/bHB5CZtBeZ
We need to make sure that information about coronavirus is accessible to everyone who needs it. https://t.co/u7rBXhI2yX
Both Mark Warner and @timkaine are working to make sure that coronavirus relief funds can be used by state and local governments to avoid laying off essential employees. https://t.co/NecAnT9lWi
Don't miss Mark Warner's virtual town hall happening tomorrow at 6:30 PM ET. Mark's excited to answer your questions about his work on coronavirus and our path forward. https://t.co/zvq2vNmfgE

Mark Warner and 15 of his colleagues are calling for decisive federal action to address the rise in discrimination and hate crimes against Asian American and Pacific Islander (AAPI) individuals during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/213R00CMjI

Mark Warner and @timkaine joined their Senate colleagues to ask for funds in the next coronavirus relief package to protect those who are food insecure in Virginia and across the country. https://t.co/g2RVcBwjiw

Mark Warner is working hard to ensure that Virginians on the Peninsula and across the Commonwealth get the medical care they need whether or not they're dealing with coronavirus. https://t.co/9hQ8Q0c27Q

Mark Warner is holding another virtual town hall this Thursday at 4:30 pm ET to answer your questions about coronavirus and everything he's working on in the Senate. Make sure you sign up below!  https://t.co/KOzxN18WQI

Mark is committed to making sure that any plan to re-open the economy relies on all of the data we have available increased testing measures and the wisdom of health care professionals and local leaders who are on the front lines of coronavirus response. https://t.co/Cx9N9Qhzbj
Tune into Mark's town hall TODAY at 4:30 PM ET. He's ready to answer your questions on the next steps in coronavirus relief and where we can go from here. Sign up here ⬇️⬇️ https://t.co/TlwT9hVvaH
Congress will soon vote on additional coronavirus stimulus funding and Mark is focused on making sure that money reaches the small businesses struggling during this outbreak. https://t.co/HPnMPeIEou
Mark is working with @dougjones @berniesanders and @dickblumenthal to guarantee paychecks to workers who were furloughed or laid off during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/MkuT4w3I7o

Virginians already have vote-by-mail and expanded early voting measures thanks to the hard work of our General Assembly. We need expanded voter access nationwide especially in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/qdlmnGbyuR

Mark and his colleagues in the Senate are pushing for the next round of coronavirus relief funding to include support for victims of domestic violence and sexual assault so that everyone is cared for in this difficult time. https://t.co/ScB3C829oo
Don't miss our town hall TODAY at 4:30! Mark is ready to talk about coronavirus response and answer your questions. https://t.co/VXHqu1obIa

The coronavirus outbreak has made the already essential role of local news even more important. That's why Mark and his Senate colleagues are asking for funding support local journalism and media outlets in the next coronavirus relief package. https://t.co/57BqDvyZbA
Join Mark Warner for a Facebook Live Town Hall on Thursday 4/16 at 4:30 PM ET to discuss coronavirus response. You can RSVP using the link below ⬇️ https://t.co/VXHqu1obIa
The coronavirus pandemic underscores why we need to provide more protections for gig economy workers independent contractors and other contingent workers. https://t.co/cdfg9Etijo
Virginia's unemployment benefits are increasing in response to the coronavirus pandemic. Learn more about these changes below ⬇️ https://t.co/Akuaz7ryYD

Mark went on @NewsradioWRVA last week to discuss the coronavirus stimulus bill. His bottom line: this isn't about partisan politics it's about making things right for Virginians and all Americans. https://t.co/qrYw8llohr
Federal workers often get the short end of the stick during moments of national crisis. Mark is working hard to make sure that doesn't happen during the coronavirus outbreak. https://t.co/v6ZHdlUbIw
Mark is holding a Facebook Live Town Hall TONIGHT to talk about his coronavirus response. Are you in? Find more details here ⬇️https://t.co/vIqIITQGjF
Don’t miss your chance to join Mark’s coronavirus virtual town hall on 4/2 at 5:15 PM ET. RSVP below! https://t.co/vIqIITQGjF
Join Mark for a Facebook Live Town Hall to discuss his coronavirus response on Thursday April 2nd at 5:15 PM ET. RSVP below ⬇️⬇️⬇️ https://t.co/vIqIITQGjF

Important: @GovernorVA just issued a stay at home order for Virginia to protect residents during the coronavirus outbreak. Learn more about what that means for your community. https://t.co/smkqY4Yi8p https://t.co/mNF6RXYZLK
Here are the measures the USDA is taking to help rural communities during the coronavirus pandemic ⬇️⬇️https://t.co/1APhKT02Xw

Last night the Senate passed the latest bipartisan Coronavirus relief package. Team Warner is thankful for the hard work that Mark and his colleagues in the Senate put in to get the job done. https://t.co/WlrLevb4Jl

As we continue to deal with the spread of coronavirus Team Warner wants to thank those on the front lines: our health care workers those who work in grocery stores and pharmacies and all of those essential workers who keep showing up to keep the lights on. We are so grateful.
We have to make sure our veterans are protected from #COVID19. Read more about Mark's asks of VA medical centers. https://t.co/QpipNbEtVi

Food banks are a vital lifeline for families across the Commonwealth. Mark and @timkaine want to make sure that they're able to get food to folks in need safely and efficiently during the coronavirus outbreak. https://t.co/xgYBvaxHmk
Any financial response to coronavirus that favors Wall Street over Main Street is incomplete. https://t.co/jHUCs3hcyP
Our coronavirus economic package is incomplete if it fails to consider small businesses and their employees. Period. https://t.co/ndB4HHfyVC

Coronavirus poses an increased threat to seniors and those with disabilities. Mark is joining his colleagues in the Senate to push the Administration to do more to address this growing threat. https://t.co/amzU83rrVt
Mark is pushing for answers for Virginians stranded abroad because of coronavirus. We need swift answers from the Department of State. https://t.co/e8NUpBx9rP
Already Uber Lyft Instacart DoorDash and Postmates have stepped up to offer coronavirus assistance to their workers following Sen. Warner's letter to the companies. https://t.co/AzE9dKy4Z1
You might have heard that we should all be working to "flatten the curve" of #COVID19. Here's what that actually means. https://t.co/g6zmM1GiAD
#COVID19 is a national emergency and the Senate should be working hard for the good of the American people. https://t.co/Mw0i7DBja9
In the meantime we all have a critical role to play in slowing and stopping the spread of Coronavirus. You can find more details from @CDCgov here: https://t.co/BzVLDH3OLm
Team Warner has made the decision to postpone all of our campaign kick-off events for next week as the Senator focuses on our country's response to the coronavirus outbreak.
